titles.title: Ozark Rivers Protection Act of 1994
A bill to withdraw certain lands located in the Mark Twain National Forest from the mining and mineral leasing laws of the United States, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S4569)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks.

committee.name: Senate Energy and Natural Resources
committee.subcommittee: Public Lands, National Parks and Forests

bill.summary: 4/20/1994--Introduced. Ozark Rivers Protection Act of 1994 - Withdraws all Federal lands within the Eleven Point District of the Mark Twain National Forest from entry, location, or patent under the general mining laws and operation of the mineral and geothermal leasing and mineral material disposal laws.
